intro: Eatonia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The species is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
